column1: She managed to merge ballet and figure skating so beautifully that the result is better than either one by itself. A perfect hybrid.
She is unbelievable.. This music, this choreography, this jumps!!!! AND HERE SHE ONLY 15!!!!!
This is literal ballet on ice. Sheer perfection
Watch Alina‚Äôs hand movement. She‚Äôs like a swan opening her wings. She is a swan ready to fly and shine.
Alina Zagitova‚Äôs black swan is the legendary of winter olympic short program. no one can ride the same. great speed and smooth ride with beautiful footwork.

What makes me sad, specially now that she is taking a break from skating and perhaps never coming back again, is that during the time she was skating and winning it all, she was not rightfully celebrated as the wonderful, talented athlete that she is. And she also didn't receive enough recognition for her achievements, compared to the reception that, for example Kostornaja is getting nowadays (what she also definitely deserves!). Instead Alina got a lot of hate, because Medvedeva and all the drama around her. I think it wasn't fair for Alina to receive that treatment. I love her, I think she is something special and I wish her all the best for her future!

Finally!! This program is a MASTERPIECE! The emotions included in it are complicate but Alina interpreted so well. Just imagine a 15 year old on her first Olympics overcome all the nerves and shines as a black swan.
The most deserved gold medal winner in the history of FS! Alina's 'Black swan' is an eternal masterpiece‚ù§ and probably the best short program ever! Thank you.
I felt it. Perfect. It was perfect.
She had problems with this program for the whole year, but when she finally nailed it at Euros, I knew she will be unstoppable at Olympics.
when i saw her dress my first thought was omg this would the perfect black swan dress then i saw the title. it's amazing
queen alina's footwork is so fast, minimal crossovers, full of transitions, fast spins and beautiful variations, amazing flow in and out of jump, beautiful balletic movements
This is how short programs should be. Concise, expressive, lyrical yet explosive.
Every time I watch this, I see the power and strength and beauty of her performance. No matter what happens to her career, she can be proud of this forever.
This program is truly a masterpiece! Alina was sensational!!

Beauty, Technique, Difficulty, Flexibility, Elegance. This is one of the best program ever.

Perfection. She has such a mature understanding of music. When the music gets chaotic and fast she perfectly reflected this in her step sequence. Even the last spin right at the end the rotations during the I-Spin  are perfeclty timed to the last echoing of the music. Seriously one of the best SPs ever created.
One of my favorite programs ever. Alina intepreted it perfectly. She needs more programs like this and Don Quixote. She was able to show off her artistry best at those.

You know why Alina won aside from the artistry and in technical terms? It was her attitude. For her, competing in Olympics is enough to make her happy. She was so motivated even during the practice, you can feel it. Without gold in mind, she is so happy while skating. Being in Olympics is magical for her whole career and that aura of joy and excitement just came out naturally, until she was announced as Champion. Until now i feel sad for her during the announcement, because she treasure Evgenia so much and she treat her like a real friend (mind you she is younger and look her up as a role model) but imagine you know your friends wanted it more than you have dreamed of bagging it (let's be honest here we all know Alina didn't expect anything she is just a happy go lucky girl) therefore she don't know how to react with overwhelming emotions rushing on her whole system (and again she is just 15,minor) but she handle it well. If i could only  get back through that time, i wish I could give her a happy environment and let her enjoy her victory. I am so happy for you Alina and to the woman you've become today <3 You are a wonderfully grown human who stands up for herself (after all who wouldn't get fed up with all those drama during you minor years). I LOVE YOU <3

She's very good technically and I'm sure she could sell really interesting choreography but... I feel like a lot of unnecessary elements were kind of thrown in there. She should concentrate more on the jumps and spins. The other moves seemed hasty, like she didn't even have time to extend her left leg and do some of the moves justice in a three and a half minute program. It lessened her opportunies to show artistry. At the Olympics the judges will be looking for anything to deduct on artistic components. Of course people will likely pile on this remark. If you think a skater can't improve, you're asking them to be overconfident.
